results.title: Salmonella Enteritidis Subunit Vaccine Candidate Based on SseB Protein Co-Delivered with Simvastatin as Adjuvant
results.text_hl: Furthermore, we evaluated rHis-SseB mixed with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ as a subunit vaccine by measuring antibody response, splenic lymphocyte proliferation, protective efficacy, and @<m>DISEASE_Bacterial_Infections</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001424 @@@bacterial@@@ colonization in organs.

results.text_hl: ...@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ is an inhibitor of @GENE_HMGCR @GENE_15357 @@@3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl CoA reductase@@@ and has been found to have protective effects against several @<m>DISEASE_Bacterial_Infections</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001424 @@@bacterial infections@@@.

results.title: Development and Optimization of Polyelectrolyte Complex Stabilized Piperine Adjuvant Simvastatin Nanoformulations for Improved Therapeutic Effect.

results.title: New Approach For Simvastatin As An Antibacterial: Synergistic Effect With Bio-Synthesized Silver Nanoparticles Against Multidrug-Resistant Bacteria
results.text_hl: Our results indicate that the combination of AgNPbio and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ could be a great future alternative in the control of @<m>DISEASE_Bacterial_Infections</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001424 @@@bacterial infections@@@, where, when combined with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, smaller doses of AgNPbio are required, with the same antibacterial activity.

citations.NLM: Figueiredo EP, Ribeiro JM, Nishio EK, Scandorieiro S, Costa AF, Cardozo VF, Oliveira AG, Durán N, Panagio LA, Kobayashi R, Nakazato G. results.title: Exploring simvastatin, an antihyperlipidemic drug, as a potential topical antibacterial agent
results.text_hl: Proteomics and macromolecular synthesis analyses revealed that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ inhibits multiple biosynthetic pathways and cellular processes in bacteria, including selective interference of @<m>DISEASE_Bacterial_Infections</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001424 @@@bacterial@@@ protein synthesis.

citations.NLM: Thangamani S, Mohammad H, Abushahba MF, Hamed MI, Sobreira TJ, Hedrick VE, Paul LN, Seleem MN. Exploring simvastatin, an antihyperlipidemic drug, as a potential topical antibacterial agent Sci Rep. 2015 Nov 10;5():16407. PMID: 26553420

results.title: Simvastatin inhibits Staphylococcus aureus host cell invasion through modulation of isoprenoid intermediates.
results.text_hl: From these findings, we propose a mechanism whereby @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ restricts @GENE_PIK3R2 @GENE_5296 @@@p85@@@ localization, inhibiting the actin dynamics required for @<m>DISEASE_Bacterial_Infections</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001424 @@@bacterial@@@ endocytosis.

results.title: The effects of statin therapy on inflammatory cytokines in patients with bacterial infections: a randomized double-blind placebo controlled clinical trial.
results.text_hl: We randomly assigned 42 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ to receive 40 mg of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ orally, followed by 20 mg of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, and 41 to receive matching placebo.

results.title: Effect of Simvastatin on the Intestinal Rho/ROCK Signaling Pathway in Rats With Sepsis.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: Treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ alleviated the @DISEASE_Sepsis @DISEASE_MESH:D018805 @@@sepsis@@@-induced increases in the plasma concentration of @GENE_FABP2 @GENE_25598 @@@intestinal fatty acid binding protein@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Lactic_Acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019344 @@@D-lactic acid@@@, as well as the number of colony-forming units in the @<m>DISEASE_Bacterial_Infections</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001424 @@@bacterial@@@ culture of the blood, liver, spleen, and kidney.

citations.NLM: Wang Y, Wang X, Yang W, Zhao X, Zhang R. Effect of Simvastatin on the Intestinal Rho/ROCK Signaling Pathway in Rats With Sepsis. J Surg Res. 2018 Dec;232():531-538. PMID: 30463769

results.title: Simvastatin augments lipopolysaccharide-induced proinflammatory responses in macrophages by differential regulation of the c-Fos and c-Jun transcription factors.
results.text_hl: The fact that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ potently augments @CHEMICAL_Lipopolysaccharides @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008070 @@@LPS@@@-induced @GENE_IL12B @GENE_16160 @@@IL-12p40@@@ and @GENE_TNF @GENE_7124 @@@TNF-alpha@@@ production has implications for the treatment of @<m>DISEASE_Bacterial_Infections</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001424 @@@bacterial infections@@@ in statin-treated @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@.
